Name: How to Train Your Dragon: Terror of the Sea
Description:
Bring your family together for this easy to learn board game set in the magical world of burly Vikings and wild Dragons. Be the First Viking to climb the volcano to WIN!

Each Viking Teen travels along the game path by rolling the die, and advances the number of spaces. The space you land on will direct you to either twist the base of your pawn either 1 or 2 "clicks" or to spin the pawn. Each pawn has 2 sides: the Viking Teen indicates the front and their Dragon is the back. Whichever direction the Teen is facing when the spinning is done is the direction the player will move next turn (forward, backward, or along the main path). First player to land on the Winner space by an exact roll "flies" their dragon up to the Volcano's cloud to final victory and WINS!

Contents: 
1 Game board with magical spaces & 3D Volcano Walls 
4 Viking Teen Pawns and Spinning Bases (Teen on front, Dragon on back)
1 Die 
Full Instructions
Families: Movies: How to Train Your Dragon

Name: Flights, England to Australia by air
Description:
Flights, England to Australia by air is a roll and move race game where players travel a path across the globe from Croydon in England to Darwin in Australia. Along the numbered path players encounter favourable or detrimental problems such as "take an extra turn" or "Return to Croydon for a new plane". The winner is the first to arrive in Darwin, Australia.

Published in Victoria, Australia, the playing map and aircraft path patriotically highlight the influence of British colonial rule during the late 20's and early 30's. Further to this it lists the pioneering aviators who made the journey during the early 20th century up to Amy Johnson in 1930.

Name: Expansion counters and rules for Michael Resch's 1914OaO and 1914SmS games
Description: These are counters that the designer created as part of an update project for 1914 Offensive a Outrance and 1914 Serbien muss Sterbien games. They include errata fixes as well as new counters to work with the designers additional Optional Rules for the games. A double-sided sheet of explanatory notes and rules is included in this package.

Name: Damn the Torpedoes!: Action Off Charleston
Description:
On January 29th, 1863 the British blockade runner Princess Royal was pursued by USS Unadilla and run aground while trying to enter the harbor at Charleston, SC.  
Her cargo included arms and ammunition as well as an unrecorded number of large rifled naval guns and two powerful steam engines slated to be installed in Southern ironclads then under construction.  
These imports were of such great potential value to the South that they have been called "the war's most important single cargo of contraband."

In thick, predawn haze on January 31, 1863, CSS Chicora and CSS Palmetto State raided the Federal blockading force of unarmored ships lying just outside the entrance to Charleston Harbor.  
Their goal was to drive the blockading vessels away from the Princess Royal and recover her cargo.

–Description from the publisher

Name: TLNB Universal (Common) Card Decks
Description:
A simple, optional "Card Enhanced" mechanic that impacts on reinforcements and movement in games in The Library of Napoleonic Battles series.

There are separate decks for the Coalition and French player.

Specific decks were originally included in each game of the series but from Napoleon's Wheel onwards a common deck will be used together with instructions in each game on how to customise the deck.
Families: Series: The Library of Napoleonic Battles (OSG)

Name: Escape Adventures Wendepuzzle: Gestrandet
Description:
After their boat was destroyed in a heavy storm, the players strand on a mysterious island. They have to solve various puzzles in order to leave again. But the island holds a secret, they didn't expect ...

Escape Adventures is played in two phases: First, the players have to piece together a two-sided, round puzzle. Than they begin to solve puzzles. Some of them require to turn the whole puzzle around, as some important information is only found on one of the sides.

A booklet contains the story of the game that develops as players solve more puzzles. To see if they solved the current puzzle correctly, players use special puzzle tiles to see if their solution forms a continuous line of a specific color.

The game aims to brimg the experience of an Escape Room to the home of the players. It can be played multiple times as no material gets destroyed while playing.

Name: Havoc! The Combat Card Game
Description:
Havoc! The Combat Card Game! is a fast-paced cards-and-dice game of deadly hand-to-hand combat.  Set in the era of swords and shields, spears and axes, Players take on the role of Knights, Barbarians, or other fighters locked in a deadly struggle.

Players can choose combat scenarios from a range of historical eras, or from fantasy settings.  After choosing fighters, weapons, and armor, Players build and shuffle decks of Combat Action Cards.  Players then draw a Hand of cards and play each Combat Action one at a time.  Players win when they kill or incapacitate their opponent.

A fighter is out of the fight when they are reduced to 0 Body, and the game ends when all fighters on one side are out of the fight.

A player wins when they reduce all their opponents' to 0 Body.

Name: Startups & Beyond
Description:
In this game, you dive into the competitive/cut-throat/ruthless world of Startups and Beyond.

All too often, the startup world is celebrated for its victories and the challenges are glorified. While there is a lot to learn from successful startups, many lessons are discovered from those that fail too. Startups and Beyond will take you through the highs and the lows of this fantastic journey as a founder of a product company.

In Startups & Beyond, players are Founders of Product Companies and have to constantly plan and execute their strategies to build an economic engine that is resilient to any external forces which make the economic cycles unpredictable.

Players can choose from different categories of products that have different manufacturing costs and lead times. 
Players can choose to redesigned their products to give a better margin or add new products to diversify their risk of competition eating into their margins.

Players play the game simultaneously where they try to snag the best talent from the market to help with the product, marketing and sales strategies. Players also have to balance their spending, can raise funds from an investor or just take a bank loan based on their finances. As a founder, players can discover hacks and overcome roadblocks during the game. Every action has a cost attached to it and affects the end game scoring.

The game ends after playing 8 quarters (2 years).

The game includes worker placement, card drafting, economics and engine building mechanisms.

Name: Gi-Go
Description:
The players each take turns placing one of the 49 game pieces on a 7x7 playing field. The player who places a tile on the last square of a vertical, horizontal or diagonal row receives the victory points for this row according to its length (vertical and horizontal 7 each, diagonal 2 to 7). As soon as the last tile has been placed, the player with the most points wins.

The game has appeared in a series of games with educational intentions.

Name: Non Speed Race
Description:
A cooperative game, a noon speed race between the turtles and the snails. The turtles look at each other or to the next turtle on the board to move on to the next step. If the players cannot find the turtle who looks at the previous turtle or the next one, the snail moves to the next step.The players win if they filled the board with turtles, before the snails moved to the last step.

—description from the designer

Name: Massive Darkness 2: Zombicide Fantasy Crossover Pack
Description:
Zombicide Fantasy Crossover Pack is a Kickstarter Exclusive Optional Buy that brings you over 110 cards to allow you to use a lot of the retail content from Zombicide: Black Plague and Green Horde in Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape. It will also allow you to use many of the Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape Heroes and Enemies in Zombicide: Black Plague and Zombicide: Green Horde!

25 Hero Cards to bring the main Zombicide Fantasy Survivors as Heroes for Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape.

54 Mob cards, 30 Roaming Monster cards and 1 Boss dashboard to bring many Zombies as Mobs, Roaming Monsters, and 1 Boss as Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape Enemies

Survivor ID Cards to bring the Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape Heroes as Zombicide Fantasy Survivors (compatible with both Zombicide Black Plague and Green Horde):

Name: Piensa Palabra
Description:
Be the fastest to find a word that meets all 3 conditions.

For lovers of word games, comes this super agile proposal to train mental skills and vocabulary. A game where participants play simultaneously, trying to be the first to say a word that complies the given conditions.

For an easier game or to play with children, you can play with two or one of the categories.

SETUP
Shuffle the 3 condition decks separatedly and reveal the top card from each one.

GAMEPLAY
Each round, players try simultaneously to say a word that complies with the 3 conditions. The first player to find that word, gains 1 point and take one of the 3 cards of their choice, and replace it with the top one of the correspondent deck. Then the next round begins.

The same word can't be used again during the next 3 rounds.
The same category can't be replaced twice in a row.

END OF GAME
The first player to reach 10 points, wins.

Name: マカリョーシカ (Macaryoshka)
Description: Each player chooses a color of macaron. Players take turns either drawing mini macarons from a bag or choosing one from their personal supply to place on the board. If once color dominates a 4 piece area the macarons grow to the next size. If an area is tied for color, the player placing the last macaron chooses which color will grow. The player that triggers the growth will also determines which color(s) return to the bag. The game ends when one player has placed their two largest macarons or no more macarons can be placed.

Name: Relick TCG: Retro begining
Description: expansion pack of the relick card game, in which you will find 20 new cards to expand the game

Name: King of the West
Description:
There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and out think them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone else's. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer

Name: Ejército Popular
Description:
The players have the role of a republican agent during the Spanish civil war. Their objective is to buy arms in the black market or in the USSR to form new Battalions for the Popular Army. The behaviour of the battalions in combat and the achievement of our agent give us Victory Points. The game is divided in Battles and each battle has several turns.
There are 'Help' cards that are useful to manage your objectives or interfere with the other players activity.
 Each player receives several Action Points, Negotiation Points, Money and Two help cards at the start of each Battle.
The battle can be 4 or 5 turns long so during that turns the players have to move their agent through the board spending their Points and money in the different boxes of the board in order to get arms, conscripts and uniforms for assembling a battalion or to send weapons to the High Command (demanded in the Battle card). Doing this gives Victory Points. At the end of the last Battle Card the player with more Victory Points win the game.
 ---
Los jugadores tienen el rol de un agente republicano durante la Guerra Civil Española. Su objetivo es conseguir armas en el Mercado Negro o en la URSS con los recursos limitados que se tiene y con estas armas formar batallones que demanda la carta de batalla que está en juego. El comportamiento de estos batallones en combate y los logros de los agentes proporcionan Puntos de Victoria. El juego se divide en 'Batallas' y cada batalla tiene varios turnos. Hay cartas de 'Ayuda' que facilitan tus acciones y tambien molestan a los otros jugadores.
Cada jugador recibe varios Puntos de Acción, Puntos de Negociación, dinero y dos cartas de ayuda al comienzo de cada batalla.
La batalla puede durar 4 o 5 turnos, por lo que durante esos turnos los jugadores deben mover a su agente por el tablero gastando sus Puntos y dinero en las diferentes casillas del tablero para obtener armas, reclutas y uniformes para armar un batallón o para enviar armas al Alto Mando (exigido en la carta de Batalla). Hacer esto da Puntos de Victoria. Al final de la última carta de batalla, el jugador con más puntos de victoria gana el juego.

Name: Asusta Cucos
Description:
In this game when the ant goes into action, the Cucos get scared. With Asusta Cucos you are going to put speed, concentration and coordination into play. The player who scares the most Cucos will be the winner.

All cards are dealt to players. Each player in turns puts their top card in the table, not covering any other card. If the And (Cuco scarer) is shown. Everyone has to cover, with their hands, cards of the most present color on the table, and they win that card if it is correct (and penalised returning a card if not).

The game ends when the last player card is shown, and each player counts the points on the Cucos bellies of the cards won. The player with the higher score wins.

Name: ConSEXuate
Description:
ConSEXuate is a game of affective Sex Education, a trivia of questions divided into the following categories: Love and Eroticism, Prevention, Debate, Body, Gender, plus an instruction manual with their respective answers.

The cards are shuffled and the deck is placed in the center, a randomly designated participant will start the game by taking a card from the deck and reading the question or trigger aloud. At your convenience you can choose a partner to help you with an answer. Once the player answers correctly (the answer does not have to be textual), he keeps the card and we go to the next player, so on, the course of the game will continue. In case of not answering correctly, you must leave the card under the deck, the answers are found in this manual, so it should be kept throughout the game.

The cards are divided into colors according to their category. When drawing a YELLOW card, the group must answer together, creating a single answer among all. The player who touched this card must draw a new one for the individual response.

The game ends when the agreed session time is over. Whoever has the most number of cards is the one who knew the most to answer about sexuality. We all win by learning!!!

Name: ConSEXuate Diverso
Description:
ConSEXuate Diverso is a game of affective Sex Education with focus on Diversity, a trivia of questions divided into the following categories: Love and Eroticism, Prevention, Debate, Body, Gender, plus an instruction manual with their respective answers.

The cards are shuffled and the deck is placed in the center, a randomly designated participant will start the game by taking a card from the deck and reading the question or trigger aloud. At your convenience you can choose a partner to help you with an answer. Once the player answers correctly (the answer does not have to be textual), he keeps the card and we go to the next player, so on, the course of the game will continue. In case of not answering correctly, you must leave the card under the deck, the answers are found in this manual, so it should be kept throughout the game.

The cards are divided into colors according to their category. When drawing a YELLOW card, the group must answer together, creating a single answer among all. The player who touched this card must draw a new one for the individual response.

The game ends when the agreed session time is over. Whoever has the most number of cards is the one who knew the most to answer about sexuality. We all win by learning!!!

Name: Arde ConSEXuate
Description:
Arde ConSEXuate is a fun, adult game that challenges you to talk about sex.

The deck is placed face down in the center of the table. The most HOT player begins and from there to the left of him he will continue the round. The starting player picks up a card from the deck, reads it aloud and performs the action / command. If he complies with this card, it remains in his power, in the event that he does not comply, he will have to have a drink or make a garment that the group designates.

Who first manages to get to keep 5 cards wins.

Name: Empatizate
Description:
It all starts with EMPATHY, which is the ability to perceive, share and understand what another may feel. With Empatizate we are going to talk about bulliyng, gender equality, racism, beliefs, safety on social networks, substance abuse. We will learn to say YES, NO and I DON'T KNOW. This game allows us to anticipate and solve interpersonal conflicts and achieve a greater emotional connection with people. When you say "Empathize", it is to put yourself in the place, defending the cause, for 1 minute in both cases in a mandatory way.

The “YES”, “NO” and “DON'T KNOW” are placed in the center of the table and 5 cards are dealt to each player.

Each player reads his cards and strategically chooses one to pass to the player on his right saying "empathize". This action must be done by everyone at the same time. The youngest begins to answer and from there to the right of him one by one during 1 round. If you meet the slogan, score points, if not. The answered letters are left on one side.

The game ends when all the cards in hand are answered. Cards are scored at the top. Whoever scores the most points wins.

Name: Hopp
Description:
With the help of wooden see-saws, you shoot colourful wooden dice into the ‘target box’. (The felt lining muffles any noise!)

Depending on the position inside the grid, the dice hitting the targets score points. Special rules also apply for skilled players; no matter how much chance intervenes, the more you play, the easier it becomes to score hits and the bar can be raised higher. The dice and see-saws can be packed into the solid and lockable wooden box to take away.

The games ends after all dice are thrown.
The player with the most points win. Points depend on the position of the dice in the Target box

Name: Martin Luther, Life and Legacy
Description:
Its October 31st, 1517 and a monk in Wittenberg, Germany nails 95 Theses to a church door asking for reform. Soon, you'll be embroiled in religious upheavals, territorial conflicts, and high politics within the Imperial Courts of the Holy Roman Empire.

This card game allows you to make decisions that influenced the political, religious, and economic causes of the Reformation - introducing you to the places, people, and events that shaped history.

You’ll direct the most powerful and influential leaders of the day such as Pope Leo X, Holy Roman Emperor Charles V, and Prince Elector Frederick III - using their talents with care during gameplay.

The game’s simple mechanics combined with multiple paths to victory gives it a fast pace providing excitement and opportunity to the very last play. We believe the unique experience Martin Luther, Life and Legacy provides -- will make it a treasured part of your game collection for years to come.

Name: 18Write
Description:
Lay track, build train stations, and run trains. Keep all the train companies at a minimal stock market value to win. Be careful, if one company does too well, the others' stock values will drop.

At the end of 10 rounds, players must have managed 3 companies stock market values so that they are above a minimum value. The game implements an "equilibrium" mechanic, where one value going up might cause another value to go down.

-"Equilibrium": Keep values in equilibrium, rather than win by VPs or efficiency.

-"Suboptimal Assistants": Work cooperatively with an AI, however the AI does not always make the smartest decisions, so you will have to carefully choose when and where to take things over manually.

The game also comes with four maps to play and "Rails" a multi-map campaign. There is also an expansion that comes with more maps and game features.

This is a PNP submitted to the 2021 Solo PNP contest here on BGG.

Name: Last War: West 1968/1989 – Expansion Pack
Description: An Expansion for Last War: West about conflict on 1968/1989

Name: VYSHiBALY: Ramstein AFB
Description:
Op VISHiBALY: The Capture of Ramstein AFB

5th June, 04:00hrs, 24hrs before CASE RED, CASE BLUE and CASE BLACK, the Invasion of West Germany, 1984 and Ramstein is assaulted by a battalion force of VDV with the intention of disrupting the REFORGER effort to re-supply and re-inforce Germany as WWIII errupts. 
At the same time VDV are assaulting Grafenrheinfeld Nuclear Power Station to tie up the 3rd Infantry Division, 
Op. Vishibaly is designed to disrupt REFORGER as well as tie up elements of the 8th Infantry Division denying them supporting 3rd Armoured and CASE RED's thrust.

Elements of the VDV are to seize and deny ramstein, take it out of action and then form up to head in formation to Frankfurt Un Der Main AFB and eliminate that... if there any survivors of Vishibaly!

The scenario set is designed with full (generic) force lists for the VDV as well as the 8th Infantry Division; 
four linked scenarios ranging from the initial assault on Ramstein, to ambushing the relief column of the 8th iD and a 1:1 type scenario where a Spetznatz team infiltrates the control tower and seizes it versus a force of USAF Security Personnel.

These scenarios are designed to be generic -so can be used with ANY rule set! 
Ideally suited for COLD WAR3! and BERLIN '84 these scenarios can be used with Team Yankee or even Command decision or Bolt Action!

–Description from the publisher

Name: Lost Mummy
Description:
The mysterious Egyptian sands hide many secrets, all of them lost to time. All of them, that is, except one! 

When your grandfather, Howard Carter, discovered the remains of the ancient pharaoh Tutankhamen, he believed there was another tomb connected to the first. A hidden tomb. A Lost Mummy. Now, many hard years and one fateful slip later, you find yourself trapped in that very tomb! Will you escape, or will you become just another lost memory buried under the sand?

The Lost Mummy is a printable escape room game that transforms any space into a kids escape room experience. The game is designed to challenge 10 – 13 year-old children. It combines the teamwork, tension, and puzzle-solving of escape rooms with the laid-back ease of group party games.

Players will work together to escape from an ancient Egyptian tomb before time runs out. Gameplay is centered on a series of sequential puzzle sheets hidden around the room. Each puzzle solved progresses the story, and puts you one step closer to escaping the Lost Mummy’s tomb. Game setup is quick and spoiler-free, and hints are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then having them race against each other to see who escapes first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.

Will you solve the mystery of the mummy’s tomb, before you’re trapped here forever?

Name: Fruit Salad
Description:
In this very simple and fun game, the players take turns trying to get all the ingredients to make a nice fruit salad: grapes, blueberries, strawberries, kiwis, tangerines and bananas. The first one to complete the set wins.

In terms of gameplay, initially there's a pile with fruit and "veggie" tokens. Each player on their turn rolls two custom dice, one with the 6 fruits on its faces and one blank, except for one face, that shows a broccoli ("veggie"). Depending on the roll, they either pick up a corresponding fruit token or a veggie token from the pile. If they already have the fruit, they have the option of picking up a second one (only up to two per fruit are allowed) or return their fruit token back to the pile.

Veggie tokens are "jokers", in that they can stand in the place of any fruit token. However if you roll for veggie and already have one, you have to give it back; you can have at most one veggie at any given time.

Winning condition is having exactly 6 different tokens (6 fruit or 5 fruit and a veggie) with no duplicates.

Name: 16 Sheep
Description:
You can’t imagine how naughty Grandpa Emmet’s sheep are! They have escaped from the pen and are hiding among the bushes. Will you be able to find them with the help of Grandpa Emmet?

Each turn, you roll the die, which will indicate the sheep you have to find and guide to your pen. The more sheep you find, the better! At the end of the game, the player that has the most sheeps behind the bushes is the winner.

Name: Lady Up
Description:
The colourful and cheerful dance of the bugs is about to start! Ladybugs, bees, beetles, and spiders gather in the meadow to have a wonderful time. They are going to perform an amazing dance, spinning around, doing somersaults... up and down in a fun and joyful choreography. Can you replicate the bugs' moves and create the same choreographies?

In «Lady Up», you compete against the rest of the players to be the first one to place your Bug tokens on the table forming the same pattern shown by the Choreography card in play.
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: The Lion and the Hunter
Description:
The Lion and the Hunter is a game where one player is the lion and the other is the hunter. Players follow a route to the lions den. Along the way they must follow instructions as the come to them along the path. 
The winner is the one who reaches the lions den first. Alternatively if the hunter lands on the space occupied by the lion after space 60 he has captured the lion and the hunter wins the game. Prior to space 60 if either player lands on the other player then the player landed on goes back to the start.

Name: Telepatio
Description:
Telepatio is a fun and engaging board game for believers of Telepathy and skeptics alike. With the help of colourful renditions of the original Zener cards as well as your very own minds, you and your friends can perform the same scientific experiment to disover which one of you has the greatest capacity for telepathic communication - or simply is the luckiest. Who knows? See for yourself!

Telepatio is turn-based and played over 24 rounds, or until the first player reaches 17 or -11 ESP points. You score ESP points by successfully sending or receiving the correct telepathic signals.

Every round a player assumes the role of a 'Sender'. The Sender rolls the Zener dice with the dice cup and views the result in secrecy. The Sender then flips over the hourglass, and must try to telepathically communicate the right Zener symbol to the other players. No words or visual cues of any kind are allowed, you must rely on the power of your mind.

By the time the hourglass runs out all other players, known as 'Recipients', must have chosen a Zener card with the symbol they believe is being telepathically sent to them. The Sender then reveals their dice roll and Recipients reveal their cards. Was the Sender successful in communicating the Zener symbol? Did the Recipients read Sender's mind, or did they score by simple guesswork?

If a Recipient chooses the wrong card, the Recipient moves one step back. The Sender moves as many steps forward as the number of correct matches from the Recipients, plus two extra steps. If the Sender does not match up with any of the Recipients, the Sender stays put.

The player with the most ESP points after 24 rounds is the most telepathic of the players, or does it all come down to luck?

Name: Smokey Game
Description:
The Smokey Game is an Australian community service board game for the prevention of forest fires. Players move by roll of a dice along a 60 space course that enters a Picnic ground and Koala sanctuary before continuing on to return to home on space 60.

Along the way certain green spaces promote good fire prevention practices and in turn help the player (i.e take a short cut). Red squares on the path highlight dangerous fire behaviour and this incurs a penalty to the player (i.e. Playing with matches go back to 26).

First player to complete the course is the winner.

Name: Tech Grid Poker
Description:
Tech Grid Poker adds a new dimension to traditional poker! Classical Texas Hold'em poker uses a single row of communal cards. Grid poker uses a 3x3 array of cards from which players make two poker hands simultaneously. Players form one poker hand using the communal cards in the rows of the grid and another poker hand using the communal cards in the columns. Additionally, each card has unique game effects which players can use to influence the outcome.

At the start of the game, a 3x3 grid of communal cards is dealt. This is called "the market". Each player is dealt 7 cards and selects 2 of them to form a company. Each turn players can use the game effect on one card in their company and one from the cards in their hands. Then, in the grid poker phase, players use their company and hand cards to simultaneously form two poker hands. One of the poker hands must use their company cards and another must use cards from their hand. One of the poker hands must use the row cards and the other the column cards in the market. The best poker hand among the rows is determined and scores the row winner point(s). Then, the best poker hand among the column hands is determined and scores the column winner point(s). Companies can be improved each round using hand cards. The game ends after four rounds.

Grid Poker uses the Tech Deck which is a game system. Each Tech Deck card has game effects, a value and domain (suit). The Tech Deck is designed to serve as the basis for many other games.

—description from the designer

Name: Awkward
Description:
Awkward is the ultimate test on finding out how well friends, couples, and family know each other!

In Awkward, on a players turn, they pick up a question card and choose between two options labelled A or B. They then place one of the voting cards (either A or B) facedown while everyone guesses which answer they chose and also place a voting card facedown. The answer is revealed and the players who guessed correctly are awarded with a Wick Point and the first to get 10, wins!

Name: Pfandstrand
Description:
The beach could be so beautiful if there wasn't trash lying around everywhere.

Pfandstrand is a fast and funny bluffing game for 3 to 5 people. The special thing about it: the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well sorted household. :)

The game is played simultaneously. All players show a number between 1 and 4 with one hand. The numbers correspond to the lanes of the playing field. Only the player who shows a number alone may move his playing piece to the next column; double numbers remain standing.

On their way, the players try to collect as much trash (game chips) as possible. The first player to reach the finish line receives two more chips. The winner is the player who was able to collect the most trash in total.

Name: Volle Scholle: Postkartenspiel
Description:
Climate change has major consequences for all of us. The polar ice caps are also melting.

In Volle Scholle, you have to pull your penguins across the melting ice to the finish line as quickly as possible. But watch out! If you risk too much, you'll swim.

Each player receives two game pieces (penguins). A player may roll the dice as many times as he wants. The numbers 3 to 6 each bring one movement point - if a player stops, he may distribute the movement points earned among his two penguins. On a 1 or 2, all points are lost and it is the next player's turn. After each round the ice melts, penguins standing on melted ice fall into the water and are out of the game. The winner is the player who gets the most penguins to the finish line, in case of a tie the fastest penguin.

The special thing about it: the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well sorted household. :)

Name: Mole-in-One
Description:
Mole: "Ouch! I can dig and build wherever I want, because you won't catch me after all!" Fox: "We'll see which one of us is the smarter one!"

Mole-in-one is an exciting bluffing game for 2 people: One person plays the fox, the other the mole. The mole can only score points by cleverly digging the tunnels. But if the smart fox catches him, the game is over.

Mole and fox start on their starting square. The mole starts and says how many ditch walks he is moving - 1, 2 (3 times in the game) or 3 (1 times in the game) walks. He notes hidden the hill he is now in. The fox may move 1 or 2 hills. If the fox is on the mole's hill at the end of the turn, the mole must admit it and the game ends.

Before his turn, the mole may show himself: he names the hill he is in and notes the points. If the mole has been caught, he adds up the points earned. Now swap roles and see who can score more points.

The special feature is that the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well-stocked household :)

Name: Ozam!
Description:
The divine protector, Ozam, guards the Sun and the Moon. Yet, these two heavenly orbs are under attack from all sides by the horrifying “Chaoscreeps”. Wizen and frail, Ozam is searching for a warrior of talents to win 3 out of 5 battles to inherit his role and power, destroy the Chaoscreep and save the Earth.

Ozam uses 5 different Card Play Conflict resolution mechanisms with differing win conditions. Players who win 3 of 5 battles, win the game.

How to play:
• Shuffle and draw a card from the battle deck.
• Follow the instruction and play.
• Anyone who wins 3 over 5 battles will become the next Ozam and win the game!

Name: Postman
Description:
the Postman has a lot of work handing out all the letters.

The quickest player in finding the neighbors to whom belong the letters, will be de winner!   The first player to match to letters, wins!
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Kenji's Quest: Book One
Description:
Kenji’s Quest takes the best elements from the 90’s era adventure/rpg console games and translates them to the tabletop. Featuring exploration, turn-based battles, mini-games, and more—Kenji’s Quest utilizes a ground-breaking Companion App to enhance the experience.

Using the Companion App, the Game Host leads the players through the game by displaying art, showing stats during battle, playing sound—like our Battle Theme below—and much more.

Designed as a trilogy, Kenji’s Quest: Book One allows for you and your friends to experience the book’s six chapters—but here’s a crucial twist—the decisions you make influence the plot, the content you experience, and eventual outcome of the story.

Name: Cross Clues: Steamy Deck & Winners Tokens
Description:
Expansion created by Datebox Club which includes 20 additional word cards and 9 winner tokens.

—user summary

Name: The Boer War
Description:
The Boer War is the first entry in this new series from Joseph Miranda and Canvas Temple Publishing. Boer War is based on the conflict between the British Empire and the Boer Republics of the Orange Free State and the Transvaal, which started in 1899 (generally known as the Second Boer War). The game covers the first year of the war; the conventional phase when the Boers could have gained a conventional victory. The latter part of the war was primarily a guerrilla conflict that did not officially end until 1902 and by which point a British victory was pretty much inevitable. In the game, each player is trying to seize an early victory: the British, in order to forestall the aforementioned guerrilla war, the Boers to gain sufficient support in Europe for their claims to full independence.

The game has three scenarios. Two of them begin with the commencement of hostilities in October 1899 and the initial Boer successes. The third begins with Lord Roberts taking command of British forces and launching the counteroffensive which took the major Boer towns.

Boer War Game Scale. One hexagon = approximately 90 kilometers. Each turn represents one month of operations. A corps represents two or three divisions plus corps echelon troops. A field force (division group) represents one or two reinforced divisions. A commando, brigade, or group represents 1-4000 fighting men.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: BattleTech: Clan Command Star
Description: The Clan Command Star includes the Dire Wolf, Summonder, Stormcrow, Mist Lynx, and Shadow Cat—no assembly required—along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards.

Name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Command Lance
Description: The Inner Sphere Command Lance includes the iconic Marauder, Archer, Valkyrie, and Stinger - no assembly required! - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike Action!

Name: BattleTech: Clan Heavy Striker Star
Description: The Clan Heavy Striker Star includes the Gargoyle, Hellbringer, Mad Dog, Ice Ferret, and Viper -no assembly required- along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards.

Name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Battle Lance
Description: The Inner Sphere Battle Lance includes the much-loved Warhammer, Rifleman, Phoenix Hawk, and Wasp - no assembly required - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards.

Name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Direct Fire Lance
Description: The Inner Sphere Direct Fire Lance includes the iconic Atlas, Crusader, Marauder II and Orion - no assembly required! - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike Action!

Name: BattleTech: Clan Heavy Battle Star
Description: Unleash the Clan Heavy Battle Star on your enemies! Turkina, Kingfisher, Huntsman, Ebon Jaguar, and Crossbow—no assembly required—along with five MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards.

Name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Striker Lance
Description: The Inner Sphere Striker Lance includes the iconic Black Jack, Wolfhound, Jenner, and Panther - no assembly required - along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards.

Name: China's Navy: Ships and Aircraft of the People's Republic of China, 1955 - 2021
Description:
China’s Navy lists the ships and aircraft used by the People’s Liberation Army Navy and Air Force and Chinese Coast Guard, in service between 1955 and the present day. It is designed as a sourcebook for Harpoon, fifth edition, but it can also be used as a general reference.

In China’s Navy, we don't pay as much attention to dimensions and propulsion plants, but do provide the game-related data you need, i.e., damage points, combat system ratings, and so on, along with ships’ sensors and weapons.

Organized as a collection of annexes, Annexes A and B provide statistics on ships and aircraft respectively as first built, and any modifications over time, sometimes many times. Annexes C and on give detailed weapons and sensors characteristics, including guns, missiles, antisubmarine weapons, torpedoes, mines, airborne ordnance, radars, sonars, and data links, with all the information needed to use them in a Harpoon scenario.

The book also provides information on land-based surface-to-air missiles and coastal defense missiles and their battery organization. Supplemental annexes list ship classifications and factors used to convert weapons and sensor information into game data.

Name: F.C.M.T.: Fighter, Cleric, Magic User, Thief
Description:
A competitive, press-your-luck dungeon delver. FCMT is set in a magical dungeoneering competition where each of the legendary RPG classes will compete to determine who is the greatest adventuring class ever.

Players will face dangerous encounters, seek loot and weigh risk in an attempt to win dungeon tokens. These tokens are turned into dungeon gems. The first player to collect 3 dungeon gems is the winner.

FCMT uses the novel Fate Deck system for determining encounter outcomes. Instead of rolling dice, players draw fate cards that can be fueled by resources to increase their chance of success.

A new dungeon is created before each game by placing out a grid of face-down dungeon cards. Players progress through the dungeon by peeking at cards, revealing cards and trying to overcome the challenges they encounter.

By overcoming these challenges, which include traps, monsters and more, players will be rewarded with dungeon tokens. Each time a player earns 5 tokens, they are awarded a dungeon gem.

As soon as a player has 3 of these gems, they are declared the winner and the greatest dungeon delver of all time.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 10
Description:
Inc0gn1t0 is a threat unlike any you've faced. Their identity and location are unknown, as are their demands. What is known is that they've hacked into networks across the city and we've found traces of a bomb that has some sort of remote access code. Can you stop them in time?

In this new expansion pack for Hostage Negotiator, you must deal with Inc0gn1t0's reign of terror across the city while trying to decrypt the code for the bomb. The more hostages you save the more time you buy for the decryption, but is it enough?

—description from the publisher

This Abductor pack is a 15 card expansion compatible with both Hostage Negotiator and Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave.

NOTE: It's a completely redesigned Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 10 and it's entirely different mechanically speaking.

Name: Mojee
Description:
Players receive nine cards of one color in their hand.  They must place their cards in the same order as the story board cards.  However, they can only place their cards on other players stacks.

Once all players have their cards, play begins simultaneously as each player tries to play their cards in the correct order and stacks.  Once a player is out of cards, play stops and the stacks are checked.

Players win if the cards were played without mistakes and you have the least number of cards.

Players can also make up their own master stories or play the game without referring to the master set to make the game harder.

Name: Bamboo
Description:
The samurai train their mental strength by filling columns and/or rows of bamboo sticks with numbers to trigger point scores.

Bamboo is a dice game in which players must first collect symbols to be thrown before they can enter them in the scoring table. If a player succeeds in filling a row or column, then this row is scored by ALL players. The more points are awarded the more different symbols are entered there. But not all rows and columns are scored, so the players have to keep an eye on what the other players are doing.

—description from the publisher

Name: Catwalk
Description:
The players have to move their cat from the starting field to the target field and walk around their territory.

Catwalk is a dice game in which the players have to walk along their territory. According to the result of the dice, you can move to fields in the territory and thus get closer to the goal. The player who does this first wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Beta Cards from Arkham Night 2020
Description:
These Beta Cards were designed at Arkham Night, 2020.

Include 2 cards.

Guard Dog (Level 2)
[Fast] Exhaust Guard Dog: Engage an enemy at your location. That enemy attacks you. 
[Reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage or horror to Guard Dog: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

Flashlight (Level 3)
Uses (4 supplies).
[Reaction] When you perform a skill test while investigating
or attempting to evade, spend 1 supply: This test gets
–2 difficulty.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Loki
Description:
Loki is the first Play-to-Role game ever created. Play through three different card games with your friends (push-your-luck, bluffing and memory) and dive into a mystical Norse atmosphere.

While you play, your actions and results will determine your fate as a character, and you will be able to start the fourth module, an immersive Role Playing adventure! The card games are designed to create a vibrant, thrilling and engaging atmosphere between players. Each participant will compete against the others or in team, depending on the card game.

Asgard is a bluffing game where players must act as a Norse deity while bluffing to stay undercoven. The last one remaining alive wins the match.
Omen is a push-your-luck & memory game where players place bets to guess the number of cards on the board. Omen cards act as a jolly and can turn luck and memory against everybody.
Valhalla is a combat game where players compete against each other and against monsters to remain the last man standing in the arena.

Once the games are complete, the results and the points obtained by the players, together, form the traits of their characers in Mask of Loki, the Role-playing game that acts as a forth module. The game comes with a handy game manual explaining the rules: Mask of Loki, in fact, is a very simple game (it takes half an hour to be mastered) that rewards cooperative play and awards poor luck in the previous character creation session.

Hours of funny, thrilling and amazing adventures in the Norse society are waiting for you. Dive into Loki and show everybody what you are made of!

Name: Meanwhile, at the Con....
Description:
Meanwhile at the Con is a fast paced hectic drafting game to create the best booth at the Convention!

Players draft 5 cards each round. After drafting, each player adds cards to their tableau to build their booth, or attracts meeples from the convention through marketing cards and generates income in various ways. The player with the most money at the end of 5 rounds wins the game!

Through clever drafting, players can choose to sell either Comic Books, Collectible Toys or Board Games at their booth and build on their quality more. The better the quality, the higher the price.

Hire the right staff for your team and make sure you don't forget your marketing. Fans and customers go to the best booths with the best marketing. Start a craze with the cosplayers or even go as far as creating your own movie based on the game or comic book at your booth!

—description from the designer

Name: Imperio
Description:
Dreams, strategy and action ... this is how an Empire is created. Invest in properties and companies, accumulating wealth and doing business around the world, with this strategy game that will make you a millionaire.

Imperio ("Empire") is a board game, in which each player will try to build their own business empire. Inspired by the market economy, Imperio proposes to simulate the economic growth of people in the real world, through the purchase of goods in any of the 34 cities of the planisphere.

You will be able to acquire houses, buildings, restaurants and hotels or set up your own factory to sell products all over the planet and manage them by moving with your own plane. You can even have your own casino, while increasing your economic power. These goods can be purchased in any of the 34 cities in which the planisphere is divided, while you move along the path of the board with your avatar. Your profession can also help in this exciting enrichment career. The acquisition of new cities will allow you to increase the number of goods at your disposal, giving you greater chances of winning the game.

Although the objective is common to all players, the strategy is their own, so taking into account market conditions, at any time during the game, you can change your strategy to win the game. The first player to meet the goal of $ 1,000,000 wins the game.

The players move along the track and advance to the position indicated by the dice. Once the city is acquired, the player has the right to collect a rent for it and can additionally invest in different goods to increase the rent. Investments can be real estate such as houses, buildings and towers with a different value for each one, both for the purchase and the income obtained. Another type of investment can be in businesses such as hotels and restaurants, which have a variable income or a casino that, being the most expensive, can be acquired when there is already capital, but the profit obtained is quite high when the players fall into that town. And finally another type of investment is the acquisition of factories that allows players to buy inputs and sell products to the rest of the players.

Market conditions may vary throughout the game and may make it necessary to modify the strategy. Likewise, these changes also allow obtaining high dividends for those who can take advantage of them.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monos en la Selva
Description:
Monos en la Selva is a game for 2 to 5 players where each one will represent a Carayá monkey, a native of South America with the ecosystem of the Misionera jungle.

Players must play cards to move through the jungle and steal resources from the trees and be the player who steals the most fruits from their daily diet. The player who scores the most points at the end of the day will be the winner.

Each turn, a player:

     play a card and executes its action
         movement
         fauna help (special action in the same tile)
         monkey fight or branches shaking (all players get involved)
    
     collects the corresponding resource from the tile
     takes a new resource from the bag and put it in the empty space
     takes a new card to end their turn with 3 cards in hand


The game end is triggered when the deck is empty or the resource bag is empty and 60% of the tiles are empty. Players do their last two actions and the game finishes.

Resources give points according to the scoring card of each player. The player with the most points is the winner.

Name: ASL Action Pack #17: Oktoberfest XXXV
Description:
Action Pack #17 is an expansion to the Advanced Squad Leader series, created for ASL Oktoberfest (ASLOK), held each October.

This year's edition contains two maps (87,88) and 16 new scenarios ranging from WWII Pacific to the Korean conflict.

Name: Arcanon: gra karciana
Description:
Arcanon  a card game is a proposition for novice players. Take a part in the Acumulatory Race and collect as many paradox charges as possible within a specific time.

Good, Strength, Beauty, Wisdom, Truth - the names of the domains that are supervised by five ministries in the O'vsemir universe. Right here in incessant  maze of political intrigues lasts fight for the absolute power. Arcanon is strategical and tactical game that throws more light on the diamond of all fields of Wisdom - Magic.

Plan your actions and manage elements in a matrix to adapt to the constantly changing situation. Do, what all mages do, bluf, reiroll dice, make and break alliances and most importantly, don't get caught. Decide where you want to win and where to lose. Maybe you will lose all battles to win the war? Only here the price for victory, may be the bitter taste of failure.

Name: Decimation: You or Them
Description:
2321: The largest city on the moon of Klathea
52-F is under attack as waves of alien ships
suddenly appear in the sky above it. You are
unable to even fire one proton blast before fire
rains down onto the city.

In this small 1-card game you are the military leader of the capital of Klathea 52-F.
Your task is to distribute the resources in a way that will defend the city, and destroy the attacking alien fleet.
To do this each turn you will be drawing a random colored cube, which you will have to assign to one of the city's military facilities.

There are three types of cubes, each with it's own use:
White cubes - are the raw materials needed to perform any action.
Red cubes - are the ammunition needed to destroy the attacking ships.
Blue cubes - allows you to strengthen the force field protecting the city, and heal the city itself when the force field is compromised.

These cubes will be placed on action spaces, which in turn form action rows.
Once an action row (compromising of action spaces of different colors) is full, you remove those cubes from the row and perform the actions linked to that action row.

After you place all of your cubes, the enemy gets a chance to attack you.
But the more damage you deal to them, the less firepower they have.

Defeat the second wave of aliens, and you win!
But let the city's health reach 0, and you are decimated...

Name: Legacy of Old Rus
Description:
“Legacy of Old Rus” is a roll and write game that seeks to reproduce the feel of a full-fledged RPG. 
 There's a long legacy campaign consisting of multiple plot missions.

You can also play the game in the casual, "one-shot" mode.

Prepare your heroes for a challenging journey to Far Away Kingdoms.
Each player takes control of a unique hero. The game takes eight rounds. During each of these rounds, you roll four dice and use their results to receive magic items and explore the world of Far Away Kingdoms. You will also develop your hero's skills, use various items of equipment and unique abilities to your advantage. When exploring the world, you will visit many interesting places and meet different characters — friendly and hostile. 
 At the end of the game, the player who gained the most glory points wins.

-The demo play will be available on Essen 2021-

Name: Big Boss
Description:
In each round of Big Boss, one player will be the first Big Boss. The Big Boss will pull a random job card and announce it as a vacancy to other players. The other players will check their blue cards (job cards) and decide which one they will go with as their current job. Then, the Big Boss will take the players cards and shuffle them together so they wouldn’t know who played which card. Then, the Big Boss will put these cards in front of the job vacancy and ask the players to put down their qualification cards. Some of the qualification cards have positive effect and some have negative effects, depending on the job and/or the vacancy. Players can either put negative effect to their rivals or put a positive effect on themselves. Cards can be stacked in case one job has multiple positive andand/or negative effects. Then, the Big Boss will call everyone for an interview session. This is the discussion phase. The Big Boss will ask the players for their current job and why they think they would be the suitable candidates for this job. A clever player would use the negative effect that was put on him and twist it to be a positive effect for them. The game depends on persuasion skill after all. A taxi driver can be a minister if you know how to convince the Big Boss. Afterward, the Big Boss will choose the winner which will get points depending on the vacancy.

(Slightly abbreviated description from the designer)

Name: Spell & Learn
Description:
Points based spelling game for children where a throw of the dice determines word type (noun, verb, etc) and word length (3-7 letters) for all players. All players begin with 100 points and draw letter tiles from the same shared pile (letters are hidden) until one player completes a qualifying word. That player rings the bell and all action stops. The bell ringing player gets 2 points per letter of their qualifying word. Other players get one point per letter in their words and they lose one point for every unused letter. the player with the most points at the end of 10 rounds wins. There are provisions included for challenges and for making the game easier for younger children.

—user summary

Name: BattleTech: Alpine/Grasslands Battlemat
Description:
Each map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map for one of the following terrain:


     Desert
     Lunar
     Alpine
     Savannah


The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together—as featured in the soon-to-release BattleTech Map Pack: Grasslands. Each of the four BattleMast displays a unique Grasslands map on the back.

Name: Sheep Sheep Hurra!
Description:
In Sheep Sheep Hurra! we will get into the skin of a shepherd looking for a job in the region of Fuente Narváez (Spain). We will compete with other shepherds to gather 10 sheep in our flock.

Use your cards to prevent your opponents from achieving their goal.

A game for 2 to 6 players from 6 years old.

Name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded Kickstarter Upgrade Pack
Description:
Miss out on the Run Fight or Die: Reloaded Kickstarter campaign? Never fear! Now, with our new upgrade pack you can pick up all the stretch goals from the campaign and get a fancy new Mutant Zombie miniature.

—description from the publisher

Name: Carrera de Mente: Cartas
Description:
A card version of the classic trivia game Carrera de Mente.

On this version players throw a coloured die to get a subject and then answer one of the questions on the card (according to the die result). If you get it correct, you can keep the card and get a new turn.

First player to score 10 cards wins.

Name: BattleTech: Initiative Deck
Description:
Enhance your battlefield tactics by substituting the Initiative Deck for the standard Initiative roll. Poor initiative position awards stronger strategic and tactical opportunities which can make up for "bad luck."

The Initiative Deck is 65 cards of 5 suits of 13 cards each in a single tuck box with a rules booklet.

Includes rules for four ways to use the deck:


     Alternate Initiative
     Initiative Effects
     Poker (four or five suits)
     Drax (a popular Free World's League game)

Name: The Apocalypsis Collection: Arcana Edition
Description:
The Apocalypsis Collection is the big box edition of three gorgeously remastered games (Nova Lux, Impendium, and Aedifex) composing an epic space opera beginning with the end of the universe. The Arcana edition of the Apocalypsis collection introduces a new Big Box table presence with beautifully remastered art, miniatures, components, and gameplay.

In Nova Lux, you will take charge of orphaned alien species that have escaped dying star systems in the wake of a galactic apocalypse. As entropy has increased to maximum, you will navigate the collapsing universe while collecting necessary resources to sustain biological life all while attempting to build an enclosed biosphere colony surrounding one of the last remaining stars. Once you do, you will need to satisfy the diverse requirements of your tenuous new galactic federation to ensure unity and hope for a new future. Manage resources, navigate the collapsing universe, build your biosphere engine, and race to establish your colony and satisfy your factions.

In Impendium, you will pick up immediately after the events of Nova Lux. As one of the leading factions of the newly founded Galactic Federation, you will set out to rebuild the universe and spread your power in the new galactic order. But be ware as you do, breaking the natural law of entropy, the mysterious void will take notice and seek to destroy everything that you have created. Recruit new factions to your cause and manage their loyalty, build new stars and colonies, manage resources, battle the void, and establish your power through diplomacy and war.

Finally in Aedifex you will see the universe from the void's perspective. Take on the role of an Architect of the Void. You will feed the machine that holds the fabric of existence together by cultivating the multiverse for it to consume. Meanwhile you will position yourself for dominance of the machine and ultimately dominion over existence itself. Aedifex is a deck-building game with unique player interactions, challenging decisions, and a perpetually evolving scoring mechanism.

—description from the designer

Name: Escape from Auschwitz (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description:
This fan, print and play scenario for T.I.M.E Stories takes the agents on a journey for recovering a report lost in the Auschwitz concentration camp in 1942. They take role of camp escapees, trying to restore the balance of history.

The story is based on real events. Despite the apparent topic, I'd say it's PG-15 due to strong language.

Name: Panic Attack! Scooby-Doo!
Description:
Scooby-Doo is trying to solve mysteries. A scary ghost gets in the way and does not let him move freely. Help Scooby evade the flaming ghost with the help of the scooby gang to be the winner.

In your turn you flip a location token to decide the location that the ghost appears, you then roll the die to move Scooby-Doo and if you land near a space with a hidden token you open it. If you land again near it, you take it. If it is a member of the scooby gang or a Scooby snack you use various abilities to win the game. If it is a monster, it gives you negative points depending of the color. Whoever has the most victory points when all the tokens are taken wins.

Name: Conquista
Description:
Conquista is a dice game in which the players conquer countries with the help of the right combination of dice. It is also possible to take over territories that have already been occupied, although this is more difficult. The winner is the player who takes over the most valuable lands overall.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chonkers
Description:
Chonkers is an original game using a traditional deck of cards. Players play cards from their hand in an attempt to win cards from a central display which are dealt out at the beginning of the game. The won cards are combined with any cards left in hand. Hands are revealed. Best poker hand wins.

This is a light family-style card game comparable to  Knizia's original Poker games found in Blazing Aces! Like those Knizia games, this is not a Poker variant, but an original game using poker rankings.

Name: Zookeeper: an independent-play game for pre-schoolers
Description: A game with no reading or counting, let pre-schoolers play together. Draw a card and put it face up in front of you. On your next turn, draw a new card or bank those face-up cards. Draw an open cage card and return any un-banked cards to the discard pile. Play until you are out of cards. The person with the largest pile of banked cards wins.

Name: Veggie Battle
Description:
Veggie Battle is a hidden goal, tile drafting and placement game  for 2-4 players.  You play the role of one of several neighbors working in shared community gardens, scheming against each other  to win the coveted "Gardener of the Year" award.

Each player receives four Goals for the game, two of which are shared while the other two remain hidden.  Players also receive three Tool cards that allow them to take actions that are otherwise outside of normal gardening etiquette.

The gardens are represented by four 3x3 grids.  Players take turns drafting tiles representing one of seven different veggies and placing them in an unoccupied slot in any garden.  Once all gardens are completely planted, players assign one goal to each garden and calculate their harvest to determine who scored the veggie victory.

"--description from the designer"

Name: Hide & Seek
Description:
One player takes on the role of the cat, the other of the mice. The cat tries to capture the mice before the mice escape. The game uses hidden movement and bluffing mechanisms.

—user summary

Name: Curse of Cthulhu
Description: Bluffing game for 2 players. Depending on the version players take turns guessing which in hand the other player is holding the Cthulhu token and decreasing the opponent's sanity points

Name: 大正吉凶なし (No Luck in Taisho)
Pictures: Orange
Description:
An expansion for Pictures by Daniela and Christian Stöhr for up to 6 players. (14+ years, playtime approx. 30 min)

Pictures: Orange is the first major expansion for Pictures, the award-winning creative family game. Two new material sets and 55 cards with 110 new photos provide more variety and lasting fun.

—description from the publisher

Name: ZombieZone (Postcard edition)
Description:
The year 2020. It's been 5 years since the zombie uprising that we now refer to as "Zombie Summer". You could say that we've since adapted to living with the undead… All you need to do is stay indoors, keep your weapons close, and don't trust anyone or anything. But as humans, we are a greedy species, and we found a way to make money off of the zombies. And that is where the ZombieZone comes in.

ZombieZone (Postcard edition) is a battle arena where 4 humans and 4 zombies will fight to the death… on live television. From the safety of our homes, we watch the destruction unfold, placing bets on or against mankind. And some of us will even risk our own lives for a chance at fame and fortune. Will the money hungry-humans, armed with a shotgun and a brain make it out alive? Or will the flesh-hungry Zombies multiply and take them over?


ZombieZone (Postcard edition) is a head to head strategic battle for survival of humans vs. zombies. 2 players each use coins and dice to maneuver around a gridded parking lot game board. Humans are armed with a shotgun for ultimate zombie destruction, and zombies spread quickly by taking over the humans (flipping the coin over to become a zombie). The last one standing wins.

If you are looking for the full edition, see here. The full game has a larger board, more units, bombs, a second win condition, and a lot more space to do what you need to do.

Name: Neko Harbour: The Card Game – King George Island Promo
Description:
Debuted at ESSEN 2021

Are you planning to visit King George Island? With this card you can explore the amazing viewpoint in Antarctica.

This card works the same as other Attraction card. Shuffle with other Attraction cards during setup.

During the game, if you are the only ship who visits the viewpoint, you will score for each your ship in game. Each ship you have in game scores 1 point. If you are not the only ship in the viewpoint, you get a Captain card instead.

When the game ends, the player whose ships add up to the highest total levels scores the full amount of VPs indicated on total ships level at their harbour.

In same fashion, The player with the 2nd highest total levels wins half of the VPs (rounded down) from the total ships level in their harbour, and 3rd place half again, etc. In the event of a tie, the player who has a ship docked at the higher level wins.

For example: You are the 1st total level at King George Island, you score full amount Penguin Points from the total ships level in your harbour. You have 3 ships stayed in the harbour, specifically their levels are 3, 4 and 6. Thus, you will score 13 points (3+4+6). In case you are the 2nd in the viewpoints, you only score 6 points (13/2 rounded down.)

—description from the publisher

Name: Friedrich de Luxe Expansion
Description:
The Friedrich-de-Luxe-expansion includes:


     24 plastic box lids for the generals
     24 labels for the lids
     120 wooden blocks
     1 set of Tactical Cards with a grey pattern
     1 set of rules


The plastic box lids have the size of a flat matchbox. They come in different colours; dark blue for Prussia, red for France, etc.

The labels have a similar look as the labels of the generals.

The wooden blocks are 11 x 11 x 6 mm in size. They come in the following colours:


     32 dark blue
     12 light blue
     16 dark green
     4 light green
     30 white
     6 yellow
     20 red


The expansion also includes a fifth set of Tactical Cards. This is useful when players run out of cards, which can happen when Prussia succeeds in avoiding battle for a long time.

—description from the publisher

Name: ZombieZone (BGotMC edition)
Description:
This is the card reimplementation of the 2012 board game ZombieZone, for the Board Game of the Month Club.


ZombieZone is a battle arena where 10 humans and 10 zombies will fight to the death… on live television. From the safety of our homes, we watch the destruction unfold, placing bets on or against mankind. And some of us will even risk our own lives for a chance at fame and fortune. Will the money hungry-humans, armed with a shotgun and a brain make it out alive? Or will the flesh-hungry Zombies multiply and take them over?


ZombieZone is a head to head strategic battle for survival of humans vs. zombies. 2 players each use double-sided disc tokens, cards, and dice to maneuver around a gridded parking lot game board. Humans are armed with a shotgun for ultimate zombie destruction, and zombies spread quickly by taking over the humans (flipping the token over to reveal a zombie on the other side). The last one standing wins.

Name: Hostile Takeover
Description:
Hostile Takeover is a basic territory control war game. You and your friends must fight to take control of the fortifications in order to establish yourselves as the true leader of the city. There are a total of four groups vying for control and none of them are ready to back down. From their base of operations, they send out their units in attempt to acquire each facility. No one is infallible though, and if a group loses all three of their units, they’re out. In this war, there will only be one victor, do you have what you need to defend against a Hostile Takeover?

Hostile Takeover is a spin on Piecepack. The additions are 12-sided dice and some blocks for buildings. If you already have a piecepack, it’ll help you save some time on getting setup. No two games play out exactly the same either, since the maps are player generated every session. It’s up to you how you play and where you deploy, but one thing is for sure, you don’t know who will win.

—description from the designer

Name: Expedition to Zanthalar
Description:
Players take a trip to the fantasy world Zanthalar, going on quests, searching for treasure, and trying to be the first person to reach ten Expedition points.

The game plays out with seven different card types (to offer meaningful decisions and plenty of customization) in addition to the in-game resource, gold. On any given turn, a player will buy cards from their favorite card types, take an action to advance their position, and barter by exchanging cards for gold.

—description from the designer

Name: Ocean's Eleven
Description:
Two players each get a conventional 52 card deck of their own, with 2s considered wildcards. Players compare the highest five card poker hand amongst all the cards they've turned up. (If fewer than five, the empty spots are considered worthless cards of a zero rank and no suit.)

Each turn, the player with the lowest hand among their best five cards then gets to either Fold or Take another card.  Folding results in a point for the opponent and all the cards on both sides being discarded.  If instead the player added a new card, hands are compared again. And again, the player with the lowest five card poker hand from the cards exposed gets to either take another card or fold.

When a deck runs out the other player gets a point and can keep playing, and scoring pts till their own deck runs out.  First to six points wins. If both decks run out game ends also, and scores are compared.

Name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): The Skyspear Avians Faction Deck
Description:
The Skyspear Avians are a group of winged warriors, capable of flying over foes and flocking into perfect formations. Led by the summoner Ava, no enemy is safe from the reach of the Skyspear Avian's aerial attacks.

—description from the publisher

Name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Cloaks Faction Deck
Description:
The Cloaks are a band of scrappy fighters and sly bandits, ready to sneak around the battlefield and launch calculated attacks with their advanced mechanical inventions and weapons. The Cloaks are led by Vlox, who has the ability to copy any other ally's abilities, adapting to any situation.

—description from the publisher

Name: Filler Clash
Description:
Filler Clash is a free board game "print to play", but you don't need to print it to play.

It was created to fill in the gaps between games, to play while you’re waiting anywhere, or just for fun. Players can experience the action of a fighting game and RPG in less than 3 minutes per player.

The idea is simple: each player chooses a character that represents a fighting class. You can use a printed or digital version of it, it's the same! Then using dice, the players will take turns to defeat each other. The last one standing wins.

And something important, depending on the table you play at, it will change the battlefield.
For example a table of 4, or for 6. Or in a bar! Even in a classroom or in the car, even at the cinema before the movie starts.

—description from the designer

Name: Reise durch den Harz
Description:
The players start at space 1 (Goslar) and the first to reach space 109 (Halberstadt) wins the game. On their turn, players roll a die and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published about 1920.

—user summary

Name: Dice Poker
Description:
Playing poker with the dice. The players take turns rolling the dice and try to get results like in poker. Points are awarded depending on the result.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dracula Dice
Description:
The players act as vampires who want to collect as much blood as possible.

Players can only collect points by rolling blood drops, but it is also possible to snatch blood from the others. The game ends as soon as a player has reached 50 points.

—description from the publisher

Name: En Garde
Description:
Life is unfair - so is this game...

Each player is 3x attacker (red dice) and 3x defender (blue dice). On the dice there are sword symbols for attack and shield symbols for defence. Blue has more dice than red - yes, unfair...

—description from the publisher

Name: Everest
Description:
The players try to be the first to reach the top of Mount Everest. To do this, they need equipment and help, as well as good weather.

The players roll the dice for the necessary equipment each turn in order to then continue up the mountain. They don't always succeed, but one will make it before the others...

—description from the publisher

Name: Kreuzworte ABC
Description:
Form words and the best letter concatenations.

The players roll letters and try to turn these letters into words. Points are awarded according to length and complexity. However, the players must also find a word each round with which they can form a sentence after 5 rounds - because this is the only way to win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lang lebe der König
Description:
A new king is appointed. But who will it be? Am I backing the right one? The winner is the player who bets on the right aspirant.

The players roll the dice and according to the result either put the aspirants forward towards the throne or increase their support - you can't do both and since you can only win with a lot of support for the aspirant who will also become king, you have to be a bit tactical...

—description from the publisher
